Job Posting:175262 - Position: W26 Front End Developer Student 175262B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/17/2025 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 11/10/2025 10:59 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country OLG 4120 Yonge Street, Suite 600 Toronto M2P 2B8 Ontario Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description GAME ON - OLG needs you 2026 - Winter W26 Front End Developer Student 175262B Co-op Position Various Locations, ON Canada 4 months In-Person CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $18.50 to $25.75 We've said GAME ON, and we mean it - OLG is rapidly transforming its organization to better serve Ontarians by delivering great gaming experiences through our digital, retail lottery, and land-based gaming channels. Over the course of fiscal 2022-23, OLG delivered a record $2.5 billion in net profit to the Province of Ontario. OLG is now expanding our horizons even further, with a new strategic direction, to become a world class gaming entertainment leader with a globally admired digital platform.. POSITION SUMMARY: Winter Student - Front-End Developer WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING: • As a Front-End Developer Student at OLG you will support a variety of design and development practices, such as: • Gather business requirements from lab team. • Ensure the technical feasibility of UI/UX designs. • Collaborate with the development team to design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code. • Develop user-facing features and build reusable code and libraries for future use. • Execute unit tests to ensure consistency across devices and browsers. Identify potential solution risks/issues and communicate to relevant stakeholders. • Job Requirements WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR: • Sound interest in designing and developing user interfaces and Single Page Apps • Understanding of coding/development • Working knowledge of different programming languages and frameworks (JavaScript, CSS, HTML, Node.js, React/Vue.js, RESTful API) • Strong communication skills to support technology and operations partners • The passion and eager to learn, and high attention to detail, strong time-management and organizational skills to manage multiple deadlines and priorities within a demanding environment. • Work collaboratively within an agile environment • Strong verbal and written communication skills Exceptional PowerPoint and Excel skills • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Special Application Instructions Application Instructions: - If you are in a co-op program, please apply through your school's portal or co-op coordinator AND through the OLG student careers page: https://olg.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/Careers-Students Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
